intro: Psychotria breweri, commonly known as the "Brewer's Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America, particularly Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its small, glossy leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Psychotria breweri is also noted for its chemical composition, which includes various alkaloids, though it is not as well-known for its psychoactive properties as other species in the genus.
